utterances: You play percussion in an afro-beat band.
Yes, I do, afro-fusion band, yeah.
And I think we have a surprise for you because we have a little bit of your music that we wanted to play on the air here.
How long have you been playing music like that?
Oh, I've been playing for most of my life.
I just moved here to join this band about eight months from the other side of the continental divide.
Good luck with the band, but enough chit-chat.
I guess it is time to play the puzzle.
I guess we'll find out, won't we?
All right, Laine and David, every answer today is the name of a Major League Baseball team.
I'll give you anagrams of their names - each with one letter added - you name the teams.
For example, if I said dress D-R-E-S-S, you would say Reds.
That one's stumping me so far.
I'll give you a hint - drop the L.
Not Lions but some other kind of animal maybe.
Your next one is costars C-O-S-T-A-R-S.
All right, I guarantee this is a team you know well.
Here's your last one: stitchable S-T-I-T-C-H-A-B-L-E.
Stitchable, like that shirt is stitchable with five stitches.
It's a team on the West Coast.
That's a tough because they always go by just their name the A's.
